attributes.action: Core infrastructure such as travel should seek approval prior to strike action
attributes.additional_details: 2016 saw an increase in strike action with a total of 269,000 days lost due to industrial action since October 2016.  This is over a 50% increase to the figures of 2015 which is 169,000 days lost due to industrial action.  Core infrastructure industrial action needs to be controlled and validated prior to strike action that will affect thousands of commuters. (figures from Office for National Statistics)
attributes.background: 2016 has seen various industrial strike actions due various industrial disputes.  Core infrastructure industries such as travel in the UK are using commuters as pawns in their negotiations.  Resolutions to disputes take too long and lead to strike action and the commuters penalised.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining exactly which organisation or body you would like to approve strike action.
